intro: Quiina attenuata, commonly known as the slender quiina, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is a popular choice among gardeners.
